page.title: 11APPLETON ROEBUCK SCHOOL 1
page.content: A{National School}was established in 1817.In 1906 West Riding C.C.built the existing school with three classrooms. It has been extended with new toilets, and three further classrooms allowing two of the original rooms to be used as a hall and dining room.The building is maintained by the North Yorkshire C.C. and is in a very good state of repair although some parts are in need of decoration.There is a{field}to the rear for sports which was drained for winter use in 1980. The current roll is 101 a decline on previous years.Children come from Appleton,Acaster Selby,Holme Green, Colton Bridge,Nun Appleton,and Colton. If they live more than 1.5 miles away they are bussed in.At 11 years they transfer to{Tadcaster Grammar School} (Comprehensive)
